findings.text: Firmware shall implement semantic versioning with rollback procedures.
Change control board approval is required before releasing revisions to the customer.

compliance_notes.action: Create a Pressure Relief Valve (PRV) sizing procedure requiring ASME Section VIII Division 1 calculations, set, capacity, and certified drawings for each PRV; ensure calculations are peer reviewed and validated against API 520 test data where applicable, with records retained per the Document Control procedure.

Implement a material traceability procedure requiring MTCs/MTRs and serial/lot tracking for all load-bearing components, with CMMS tagging, a central log for heat numbers and inspection status, and random audits to verify chain-of-custody and record retention.

Adopt a grounding/bonding procedure aligned with IEC 60204-1, including cabinet earth terminals, protective conductor sizing, torque specifications, continuity verification, and label requirements; require test records before energization.

Establish a cable identification standard requiring unique, cross-referenced identifiers at both terminations and within panels, aligned with IEC 60204-1 Clause 13; enforce through pre-handover checks and a wiring verification log.

Develop a functional safety workflow per ISO 13849-1 requiring preliminary hazard analysis, SIL/PLr allocation, subsystem MTTFd/DCavg/CCF calculations, verification reports, and validation documentation prior to deployment.

Adopt a firmware versioning policy using semantic versioning with release notes, version tags, traceability to build artifacts, and documented rollback procedures; require configuration baselines and release approval in the CCB.

Stand up a Change Control Board with defined gates, roles, criteria, and risk/impact assessment; require signed ECNs and release notes, and ensure customer notifications and version control for all customer-facing revisions.
